facts: First discovered in 1889 by Othniel Charles Marsh
Triceratops is a famous extinct genus of herbivorous dinosaurs of the Ceratopsidae family
Many remains of the genus Triceratops have been collected since its discovery in 1889
The largest known skull measures in at 5 feet long.
The Tyrannosaurus-rex or T-rex was a super-predator dinosaur at the top of the food chain
Tyrannosaurus was a bipedal carnivore with a massive skull balanced by a long powerful tail
Anklyosaurus survived for approximately 135 million years.
An asteroid was named 9954 Brachiosaurus in 1991.
This herbivore with a long neck could reach 25 meters long
About fifty fossils are known, found in North America, Africa and Portugal.
The Stegosaurus had between 17 and 22 seperate places and flat spines.
Its fossils have been found mainly in North America, in the states of Wyoming, Utah and especially Colorado
Elasmosaurus was a marine reptile first discovered in Kansas.
Measuring 10.3 meters long, the elasmosaurus would have had a streamlined body with paddle-shaped limbs
Actually a flying reptile, the Pteranodon is not a dinosaur.
Pteranodon was 7 meters long and weighed 25 kilos
The pteranodon is easily recognized by the long, thin crest above its skull.
